chapters.name: Augustine: On Grace and Free Will (Retractions) 1

verses.name: Augustine: On Grace and Free Will (Retractions) 1:1
Augustine: On Grace and Free Will (Retractions) 1:2
verses.text: Chapter 66,  On the Following Treatise,  "de gratia et libero arbitrio".

verses.name: Augustine: On Grace and Free Will (Retractions) 1:3
verses.text: There are some persons who suppose that the freedom of the will is denied whenever God's grace is maintained, and who on their side defend their liberty of will so peremptorily as to deny the grace of God.

verses.name: Augustine: On Grace and Free Will (Retractions) 1:4
verses.text: This grace, as they assert, is bestowed according to our own merits.

verses.name: Augustine: On Grace and Free Will (Retractions) 1:5
verses.text: It is in consequence of their opinions that I wrote the book entitled On Grace and Free Will.

verses.name: Augustine: On Grace and Free Will (Retractions) 1:6
verses.text: This work I addressed to the monks of Adrumetum,  in whose monastry first arose the controversy on that subject, and that in such a manner that some of them were obliged to consult me thereon.

verses.name: Augustine: On Grace and Free Will (Retractions) 1:7
verses.text: The work begins with these words: "With reference to those persons who so preach the liberty of the human will".
